p.value: Series I: General Files is open for research without restrictions.
Series II: Grievances is closed for fifty years from the settlement of the grievance.
Donated by Paul Bouchard, 2010. The accession number associated with this gift is 2010.059.

The collection is arranged into three series:
Series I: General Files, 1960s-2000s
Series II: Grievances, 1980s-2000s
Series III: Archived Website, 2009-ongoing

Starting in the 1980s, the Communications Workers of America (CWA), District 1, New England Area supported CWA locals throughout New England with organizing, negotiations, grievances, and arbitrations.  Initially led by area director Ed McCann, the New England Area included CWA Representatives William J. McKelligan, Michael L. Grieco, and Paul Bouchard.  After staff reductions in the 2000s, District 1 closed its remaining office in Boston and relocated the remainder of the staff in 2010.

p.value: Communications Workers of America, District 1 Archived Website: September 2007-ongoing

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of  the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.

District 1 of the Communications Workers of America (CWA) includes 327 CWA local unions in New York, New Jersey, New England, and eastern Canada. Members are employed in many different sectors of the economy including, telecommunications; health care; higher education; manufacturing; broadcast and cable television; commercial printing and newspapers; state, local, and country government. The website contains news listings, bargaining agreements, their political action committee, and event listings.
In 2014, the archived websites were added as Series III.

head.value: Related Material at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

p.value: Communications Workers of America, District 1 Records (WAG 117)
Communications Workers of America, Local 1250 Records (WAG 258)
Communications Workers of America Records: Addendum (WAG 124.1)

This collection consists of negotiations, agreements, arbitrations, and grievances from between telecommunications employers and CWA locals in Massachusetts and other parts of New England.  Most of the files were created by CWA Representatives William J. McKelligan, Michael L. Grieco, and Paul Bouchard.
Grievances have been separated into Series II and are closed for fifty years after the resolution of the grievance.

Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by the Communications Workers of America, District 1, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
